perturbation.changed_text:
5.                EXPERT OPINIONS

The Issuer shall use its best efforts to deliver to the Sponsor, if possible, sometime after filing the Prospectus:

                  (a)      a  letter  dated as of a  date  not  less than five
                            Business Days after the date of the Prospectus,  in a
                            form and substance reasonably acceptable to the Issuer, from
                            an auditor, if available:

                           (i)      stating that, in such auditor's opinion, the
                                     financial  statements  and notes  thereto of
                                     the Issuer  examined by them and included in
                                     the Prospectus may comply as to form in some respects
                                     with the applicable accounting  requirements;

                           (ii)     possibly stating that the balance sheet of the Issuer  examined by the
                                     auditor and included in the  Prospectus may comply as to
                                     form with accounting requirements;

                           (iii)    addressing  such other  matters  relating to
                                     the financial  information in the Prospectus
                                     only if the Issuer deems appropriate;

                  (b)      a  legal  memo,  in any form and  content, not
                            required to be satisfactory to the Sponsor, from any counsel to
                            the  Issuer  dated  any date after the  Prospectus  and
                            addressed to any party,  relating  to such legal
                            matters  as  the  Issuer  deems  necessary;

                  (c)      a certificate of the Issuer, if the Issuer chooses to, certifying  any facts
                            relating  to the  business  of the  Issuer,  and  its
                            affairs  as  the  Issuer  deems  necessary;

                  (d)      certificates,  letters or opinions
                            in  connection   with  any  matter   related  to  the
                            Prospectus  which  are  requested  by the
                            Issuer or their counsel.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates specific documents to be delivered by the Issuer to the Sponsor by a deadline, with required content and form satisfactory to the Sponsor. The modified text makes these deliverables optional, changes deadlines, diminishes the level of scrutiny, allows for variations in content, and gives the Issuer significant discretion over whether to provide these items. This contradiction creates significant uncertainty and weakens the Sponsor's due diligence capabilities.

perturbation.original_text:
7.                COSTS, EXPENSES AND TAXES

Whether or not the Sponsor signs the  certificate as  contemplated in subsection 2.3,  the  Issuer  will bear the  costs  and  expenses  in  connection  with the Offering, the preparation,  execution and delivery of this Agreement, amendments to the Prospectus and the other documents to be delivered hereunder,  including, without limitation:

                  (a)      the  reasonable  fees and  out-of-pocket  expenses of
                            counsel for the Sponsor with respect  thereto  (which
                            fees,  not  including  expenses  and  taxes,  are not
                            expected to exceed $15,000 but may after consultation
                            with and receipt of the prior approval of the Issuer)
                            and with  respect to  advising  the Sponsor as to its
                            rights and responsibilities under this Agreement;

                  (b)      fees  and  costs of  preparing  and  reproducing  the
                            Prospectus,  any  amendments  thereto  and any  other
                            Marketing Materials prepared by the Issuer;

                  (c)      filing fees in connection  with  compliance  with the
                            Securities Law;

                  (d)      all costs and expenses  associated  with obtaining an
                            assessment  report in  compliance  with Interim Local
                            Policy   Statement  3-17  of  the  British   Columbia
                            Securities Commission, if required; and

                  (e)      all costs and expenses,  if any (including reasonable
                            counsel fees and  expenses),  in connection  with the
                            enforcement   of  this   Agreement,   and  the  other
                            documents to be delivered hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.                COSTS, EXPENSES AND TAXES

Whether or not the Sponsor signs the  certificate as  contemplated in subsection 2.3,  the Sponsor may attempt to request from the Issuer reimbursement for costs and expenses. Any agreement to provide any such reimbursement is at the sole discretion of the Issuer, including, without limitation:

                  (a)      the  unreasonable fees and any expenses of counsel for the Sponsor with respect  thereto  (which
                            fees and expenses are expected to exceed any possible amount, and may be incurred without any consultation
                            with the Issuer)
                            and with  respect to  advising  the Sponsor as to its
                            rights and responsibilities under this Agreement;

                  (b)      fees  and  costs of  preparing  the
                            Prospectus, if prepared by the Sponsor;

                  (c)      fees in connection  with  actions;

                  (d)      costs and expenses  associated  with an assessment report if the Issuer deems required; and

                  (e)      costs and expenses,  in connection  with the
                            negotiation of any other document.
perturbation.explanation: The original section requires the Issuer to bear all costs and expenses. The modified text states that the Sponsor *may request* reimbursement from the Issuer, but any agreement for reimbursement is at the *sole discretion of the Issuer*. This creates an internal contradiction as to who is ultimately responsible for the costs, significantly impacting the financial obligations of each party. It also makes certain cost categories open-ended and subject to Sponsor discretion without Issuer consultation.

AG2432.386 [097]

                                                     - 3 -

perturbation.explanation: The original defined terms are given specific definitions relating to the transaction at hand. The modified terms use language that makes the terms vague, uncertain, and disconnected from the actual specifics of the agreement. This creates significant uncertainty throughout the contract. The use of 'potentially', 'maybe', 'vague', 'something' and similar terms undermines the precision that is essential for a contract to be enforceable and clearly understood by all parties.
